page.title: 20APPEARANCES - DISAPPEARANCES
page.content: Milk churns standing at the roadside awaiting collection were once a common feature of the area, but during the past few years, the churns have vanished and the blue bulk tanker of the Milk Marketing Board has taken their place. Round bales and larger bales (of hay) are becoming increasingly common, but many more meadows are now cut for silage, which is being stored in or under black polythene. The Council Highways depot at Bainbridge, which has, over the years, done an excellent job keeping difficult roads open and under repair, is about to be closed. The increase in the numbers of low-flying military aircraft is causing much local concern, both from the point of view of the danger and the effect on tourism.
